verses.verse: Now <S%G3767><s%> when Festus <S%G5347><s%> was come <S%G1910><s%> into the province <S%G1885><s%>, after <S%G3326><s%> three <S%G5140><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> he ascended <S%G305><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%>.

Then <S%G1161><s%> the high priest <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the chief <S%G4413><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> informed <S%G1718><s%> him <S%G846><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> besought <S%G3870><s%> him <S%G846><s%>,

And desired <S%G154><s%> favour <S%G5485><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, that <S%G3704><s%> he would send for <S%G3343><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2419><s%>, laying <S%G4160><s%> wait <S%G1747><s%> in <S%G2596><s%> the way <S%G3598><s%> to kill <S%G337><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

But <S%G3303><s%> <S%G3767><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> answered <S%G611><s%>, that Paul <S%G3972><s%> should be kept <S%G5083><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%>, and <S%G1161><s%> that he himself <S%G1438><s%> would <S%G3195><s%> depart <S%G1607><s%> <S%G1722><s%> shortly <S%G5034><s%> thither.

Let them therefore <S%G3767><s%>, said <S%G5346><s%> he, which among <S%G1722><s%> you <S%G5213><s%> are able <S%G1415><s%>, go down with <S%G4782><s%> me, and accuse <S%G2723><s%> this <S%G846><s%> man <S%G435><s%>, if <S%G1536><s%> there be <S%G2076><s%> any wickedness <S%G1536><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> him <S%G5129><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when he had tarried <S%G1304><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> them <S%G846><s%> more <S%G4119><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> ten <S%G1176><s%> days <S%G2250><s%>, he went down <S%G2597><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%>; and the next day <S%G1887><s%> sitting <S%G2523><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the judgment seat <S%G968><s%> commanded <S%G2753><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> to be brought <S%G71><s%>. more: or, as some copies read, no more than eight or ten days

And <S%G1161><s%> when he <S%G846><s%> was come <S%G3854><s%>, the Jews <S%G2453><s%> which came down <S%G2597><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%> stood round about <S%G4026><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> laid <S%G5342><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> and grievous <S%G926><s%> complaints <S%G157><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>, which <S%G3739><s%> they could <S%G2480><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> prove <S%G584><s%>.

While he answered <S%G626><s%> for himself <S%G846><s%>, Neither <S%G3754><s%> <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> the law <S%G3551><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%>, neither <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> the temple <S%G2411><s%>, nor yet <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> Caesar <S%G2541><s%>, have I offended <S%G264><s%> any thing at all <S%G5100><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%>, willing <S%G2309><s%> to do <S%G2698><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> a pleasure <S%G5485><s%>, answered <S%G611><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>, and said <S%G2036><s%>, Wilt thou <S%G2309><s%> go up <S%G305><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%>, and there <S%G1563><s%> be judged <S%G2919><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> these things <S%G5130><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> me <S%G1700><s%>?

Then <S%G1161><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>, I stand <S%G1510><s%> <S%G2476><s%> at <S%G1909><s%> Caesar's <S%G2541><s%> judgment seat <S%G968><s%>, where <S%G3757><s%> I <S%G3165><s%> ought <S%G1163><s%> to be judged <S%G2919><s%>: to the Jews <S%G2453><s%> have I done <S%G91><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> wrong <S%G91><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> <S%G2532><s%> thou <S%G4771><s%> very well <S%G2566><s%> knowest <S%G1921><s%>.

For <S%G1063><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> <S%G3303><s%> I be an offender <S%G91><s%>, or <S%G2532><s%> have committed <S%G4238><s%> any thing <S%G5100><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death <S%G2288><s%>, I refuse <S%G3868><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> to die <S%G599><s%>: but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> there be <S%G2076><s%> none <S%G3762><s%> of these things <S%G3739><s%> whereof these <S%G3778><s%> accuse <S%G2723><s%> me <S%G3450><s%>, no man <S%G3762><s%> may <S%G1410><s%> deliver <S%G5483><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> unto them <S%G846><s%>. I appeal unto <S%G1941><s%> Caesar <S%G2541><s%>.

Then <S%G5119><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%>, when he had conferred <S%G4814><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> the council <S%G4824><s%>, answered <S%G611><s%>, Hast thou appealed unto <S%G1941><s%> Caesar <S%G2541><s%>? unto <S%G1909><s%> Caesar <S%G2541><s%> shalt thou go <S%G4198><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> after <S%G1230><s%> certain <S%G5100><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> king <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Bernice <S%G959><s%> came <S%G2658><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%> to salute <S%G782><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when <S%G5613><s%> they had been <S%G1304><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> many <S%G4119><s%> days <S%G2250><s%>, Festus <S%G5347><s%> declared <S%G394><s%> Paul's <S%G3972><s%> cause <S%G2596><s%> unto the king <S%G935><s%>, saying <S%G3004><s%>, There is <S%G2076><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G435><s%> left <S%G2641><s%> in bonds <S%G1198><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> Felix <S%G5344><s%>:

About <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%>, when <S%G1096><s%> I <S%G3450><s%> was <S%G1096><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%>, the chief priests <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the elders <S%G4245><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> informed <S%G1718><s%> me, desiring <S%G154><s%> to have judgment <S%G1349><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

To <S%G4314><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I answered <S%G611><s%>, <S%G3754><s%> It is <S%G2076><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> the manner <S%G1485><s%> of the Romans <S%G4514><s%> to deliver <S%G5483><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> die <S%G684><s%>, before <S%G4250><s%> that <S%G2228><s%> he which is accused <S%G2723><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> the accusers <S%G2725><s%> face to face <S%G2596><s%> <S%G4383><s%>, <S%G5037><s%> and have <S%G2983><s%> licence <S%G5117><s%> to answer for himself <S%G627><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> the crime laid against him <S%G1462><s%>.

Therefore <S%G3767><s%>, when they <S%G846><s%> were come <S%G4905><s%> hither <S%G1759><s%>, without <S%G4160><s%> any <S%G3367><s%> delay <S%G311><s%> on the morrow <S%G1836><s%> I sat <S%G2523><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the judgment seat <S%G968><s%>, and commanded <S%G2753><s%> the man <S%G435><s%> to be brought forth <S%G71><s%>.

Against <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> when the accusers <S%G2725><s%> stood up <S%G2476><s%>, they brought <S%G2018><s%> none <S%G3762><s%> accusation <S%G156><s%> of such things as <S%G3739><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> supposed <S%G5282><s%>:

But <S%G1161><s%> had <S%G2192><s%> certain <S%G5100><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> against <S%G4314><s%> him <S%G846><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> their own <S%G2398><s%> superstition <S%G1175><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> one <S%G5100><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%>, which was dead <S%G2348><s%>, whom <S%G3739><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> affirmed <S%G5335><s%> to be alive <S%G2198><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> because I <S%G1473><s%> doubted <S%G639><s%> of <S%G1519><s%> such <S%G5127><s%> manner <S%G4012><s%> of questions <S%G2214><s%>, I asked <S%G3004><s%> him whether <S%G1487><s%> he would <S%G1014><s%> go <S%G4198><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2419><s%>, and there <S%G2546><s%> be judged <S%G2919><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> these matters <S%G5130><s%>. I doubted: or, I was doubtful how to enquire hereof

But <S%G1161><s%> when Paul <S%G3972><s%> had appealed <S%G1941><s%> to be reserved <S%G5083><s%> <S%G846><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> the hearing <S%G1233><s%> of Augustus <S%G4575><s%>, I commanded <S%G2753><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to be kept <S%G5083><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> <S%G3739><s%> I might send <S%G3992><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> Caesar <S%G2541><s%>. hearing: or, judgment

Then <S%G1161><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%>, I would <S%G1014><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> hear <S%G191><s%> the man <S%G444><s%> myself <S%G846><s%>. To morrow <S%G839><s%>, <S%G1161><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> he, thou shalt hear <S%G191><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

And on the morrow <S%G1887><s%>, when <S%G3767><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> was come <S%G2064><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> Bernice <S%G959><s%>, with <S%G3326><s%> great <S%G4183><s%> pomp <S%G5325><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> was entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the place of hearing <S%G201><s%>, with <S%G4862><s%> <S%G5037><s%> the chief captains <S%G5506><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> principal <S%G2596><s%> <S%G1851><s%> men <S%G435><s%> of <S%G5607><s%> the city <S%G4172><s%>, at <S%G2532><s%> Festus' <S%G5347><s%> commandment <S%G2753><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> was brought forth <S%G71><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> said <S%G5346><s%>, King <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G435><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> are here present <S%G4840><s%> with us <S%G2254><s%>, ye see <S%G2334><s%> this man <S%G5126><s%>, about <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the multitude <S%G4128><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> have dealt <S%G1793><s%> with me <S%G3427><s%>, both <S%G5037><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> also here <S%G1759><s%>, crying <S%G1916><s%> that he ought <S%G1163><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> to live <S%G2198><s%> any longer <S%G3371><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> when I <S%G1473><s%> found <S%G2638><s%> that he <S%G846><s%> had committed <S%G4238><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death <S%G2288><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> <S%G1161><s%> that he himself <S%G846><s%> hath appealed <S%G5127><s%> to <S%G1941><s%> Augustus <S%G4575><s%>, I have determined <S%G2919><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

Of <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> certain <S%G804><s%> thing <S%G5100><s%> to write <S%G1125><s%> unto my lord <S%G2962><s%>. Wherefore <S%G1352><s%> I have brought <S%G4254><s%> him <S%G846><s%> forth <S%G4254><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> you <S%G5216><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> specially <S%G3122><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> thee <S%G4675><s%>, O king <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%>, that <S%G3704><s%>, after examination <S%G351><s%> had <S%G1096><s%>, I might have <S%G2192><s%> somewhat <S%G5100><s%> to write <S%G1125><s%>.

For <S%G1063><s%> it seemeth <S%G1380><s%> to me <S%G3427><s%> unreasonable <S%G249><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> a prisoner <S%G1198><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> not withal <S%G3361><s%> to signify <S%G4591><s%> the crimes <S%G156><s%> laid against <S%G2596><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.
